title: OS X El Capitan 10.11.0 bootable USB (DMG File) (15A284)
description:
Use the "Restore" option in Disk Utility to write it down on a USB-stick.

Enjoy!
â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”
How to do info.. (OS X Versions before El Capitan)

Format Your USB Flash Drive..
1. Insert the USB flash drive into your Macâ€™s USB port.
2. Launch Disk Utility, located at /Applications/Utilities/.
3. In the list of drives attached to your Mac, select the USB flash drive device. In my case, itâ€™s called â€œ16 GB TDK Stickâ€.
4. Click the â€˜Partitionâ€™ tab.
5. Select â€˜1 Partitionâ€™ from the Volume Scheme dropdown menu.
6. Enter a descriptive name for your flash drive; I chose "OSXUSBInstall"
7. Select Mac OS X Extended (Journaled) from the Format dropdown menu.
8. Click the â€˜Optionsâ€™ button.
9. Select â€˜GUID Partition Tableâ€™ from the list of available partition schemes.
10. Click â€˜OK.


Now the USB flash drive is prepared you can Restore "Install OS X El Capitan.dmg" to your USB flash drive.

1. Click on "Restore" in the Disk Utility window.
2. Drag "Install OS X El Capitan.dmgâ€ to "Source"
3. Drag the usb flash drive (in my case "OSXUSBInstall") to "Destination"
4. Click "Restore" and enter your system password.

(To install OS X restart your Mac with â€œaltâ€ hold and select your USB flash drive)

Done
â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”
How to do info.. (When El Capitan is already installed)

Format Your USB Flash Drive.. 
1. Insert the USB flash drive into your Macâ€™s USB port.
2. Launch Disk Utility, located at /Applications/Utilities/.
3. In the list of drives attached to your Mac, select the USB flash drive device. In my case, itâ€™s called â€œ16 GB TDK Stickâ€.
4. Click on â€œEraseâ€
5. Enter a descriptive name for your flash drive; I chose "OSXUSBInstall"
6. Select Mac OS X Extended (Journaled) from the Format dropdown menu.
7. For Scheme choose â€œGuid Partition Mapâ€
6. And click â€œEraseâ€


Now the USB flash drive is prepared you can Restore "Install OS X El Capitan.dmg" to your USB flash drive.

1. Open Disk Utility
2. In the menu left of the â€œDisk Utilityâ€ window select the USB Drive.
   (The one you gave a specific name) In my case â€œOSXUSBInstallâ€
3. In the top menu bar from â€œDisk Utilityâ€  click â€œEditâ€ / â€œRestoreâ€


4.Click on â€œImageâ€ and go to the DMG File with El Capitan named â€œInstall OS X El Capitanâ€ and click â€œOpenâ€

In the next  window you see:
Restore from: Install OS X El Capitan.dmg

5. Now click â€œRestoreâ€ 

It takes about 3 minutes to restore (In my case :-)

(To install OS X restart your Mac with â€œaltâ€ hold  and select your USB flash drive)

Done..
